Package org.apache.sis.storage.event

package org.apache.sis.storage.event
Provides interfaces and classes for dealing with different types of events fired by resources. The different types of events are specified by the Store足Event subclasses. For example if a warning occurred while reading data from a file, then the Data足Store implementation should fire a Warning足Event.

Events may occur in the following situations:

  • When a warning occurred.
  • When the data store content changed (e.g. new feature instance added or removed).
  • When the data store structure changed (e.g. a column is added in tabular data).
  • Any other change at implementation choice.
Users can declare their interest to a specific kind of event.
Since:
1.2

Defined in the sis-storage module

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.apache.sis.storage
    Data store base types for retrieving and saving geospatial data in various storage formats.
  • Class
    Description
    StoreEvent
    Parent class of events happening in a data store resource.
    StoreListener<T extends StoreEvent>
    An object which listens for events (typically changes or warnings) occurring in a resource or one of its children.
    StoreListeners
    Holds a list of Store足Listener instances and provides convenience methods for sending events.
    WarningEvent
    Describes non-fatal errors that occurred in a resource or a data store.
